main event: On December 1, 1957, multiple observers in Argentia & St. John's area of Newfoundland reported seeing a large flash of light in the sky that resembled an explosion, accompanied by a thunderous noise.
interesting points: The sighting lasted approximately 1 minute 30 seconds., The object was described as a large flash of light that passed across the sky., Military personnel and civilians reported the sighting, including sailors and a local radio station manager., Observers described the flash as similar to an explosion., Weather conditions at the time were reported as light rain and snow, which were considered too stable to produce lightning.
witness description: military personnel and civilians from the area
